website_summaries.verdict: Absolutely no need to choose between a stove and a grill when both are built into one efficient unit.
pros: Built-in panels keep stove protected from high winds
Food and water both heat quickly
Can purchase a griddle to go with the unit
Users love how easy it is to use and clean, especially if lining with foil first
cons: Does not have a push-button start and requires a match to light
Some users feel the knobs stick out too far

website_summaries.verdict: This perfect camping companion comes in a convenient carrying case.
pros: Uses high-quality steel to keep it rustproof
Fold-away Wind Block panels help to keep the flame protected from the elements
2-in-1 design that can be used as a stove or a grill
cons: The 2 burners are adjustable, but customers say that the flames are basically only high or low

customer_reviews.title: Safety Hazard!
customer_reviews.text: Upon first use of this product using for less than 20 minutes it melted. I assume we have received a faulty product and have contacted for a refund but please be very careful as we are avid campers and had a previous Coleman stove and NEVER seen anything like this before.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Burgie

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable. Grill melted (!) before we finished the first tank of gas!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, revising my review from 1 star to 2 because Coleman customer service was terrific and replaced this with a new (different) model. I would still strongly encourage anyone to avoid this model. I'm not sure what material the grill is made of but it melts. My original review in brackets below. Thanks [Wow, what total junk! I typically have good experience with Coleman products (we have a tent we like) but we only used this 3 times before it completely melted. It was total junk. Incomprehensibly, the grill seems to have been made out of some type of plastic. See attached pictures.]
customer_reviews.author: jdt2

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for everything
customer_reviews.text: I love the versatility of this stove. I did purchase the griddle to go with it, and it worked out perfectly for feeding five people on our recent camping trip. It's easy to use, and has plenty of room for everything. Put the left windscreen down to use a pan and the griddle/grill at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Dyreka Klaus

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: First of all it is a match light stove. You have to lift the grill to light it. When the flame goes out you have to lift the grill with food on it in order to relight it. The grease tray is right where the propane tank is so it is difficult to pull it out for cleaning. Then it is hard to line it back up to put it back in. We used our grill twice. It is pitted out. It is hard to put the wind guards on and off. Very easy to tip over. I am returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: anita doran

customer_reviews.title: Line the bottom of the grill part with foil for quick and easy cleanup. Be sure to poke a hole for ...
customer_reviews.text: You need this stove! Line the bottom of the grill part with foil for quick and easy cleanup. Be sure to poke a hole for the oil and grease to drain. This thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Albert S.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this stove ..  Coleman discontinued ....
customer_reviews.text: First READ all reviews .. this stove has history of major grill issue. So I try and get a griddle that is listed in owners manual and Coleman has discontinued making that part. So at this time you can buy the stove but NOT some of the accessories and/or replacement parts???? AVOID!!!
customer_reviews.author: resjr

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Reviews
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what everyone is talking about. I looked at all of the reviews and it did not look good. The stove gets so hot that it melts the grill? Terrible control of the flame? All I can say is these people have no experience with a camping stove apparently. Mine works like a charm!! I cook with a 10” frying pan all the time, either side of the stove, doesn’t matter! I can go from simmer to a towering inferno and not damage the grill at all. Don’t listen to these people, they just don’t know what their talking about! “EXCELLENT COOK STOVE “!!!
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: do not put a pot on the grill and this should last a lifetime - it's a fantastic grill!
customer_reviews.text: I am so grateful I read through many of the reviews on this camp stove. Many people showed melted grills that scared me. One person wrote something like, "if you follow the directions it says do not put a pot on the grill". So if I need a pot I'll put it on the little burner to left. This cooks quick (faster than I thought it would) and made the BEST hamburgers I've ever grilled - perfect inside and out! It is small so the burner is right next to the grill but very workable. Since camping I've come home and continued to use it instead of my large propane grill - it's just easier to cook on and clean.
customer_reviews.author: selah

customer_reviews.title: Loved it. My only complaint is that the right ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use this for our camping trip last weekend. Loved it. My only complaint is that the right side grill burner isn't terribly adjustable (or visible). It does the trick but I will stick with using my cast iron on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: No heat adjustment!!!
customer_reviews.text: This produc is garbage, Coleman isn’t what they used to be. Wind flaps fall out easy slamming lid, no heat adjustment pretty much full open or nothing, grate is made of some cheap coated aluminum (looks like cast), takes forever to boil water, no way for heat directed. Bought this on intentions how good Coleman used to be, and ended up buying camp chef Everest to replace for around same money with better features and just taking out of box could tell how much better construction is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Aluminum grill rack warped on first use
customer_reviews.text: Bought for camping and hurricane preparedness. Pros are it folds and is very portable. Cons are the grill rack starting warping/melting after the first and only day I used it. Went through 4x $6 propane tanks to make bacon and eggs, hot chocolate and Mac and cheeses for the 30 hours camping. The rest of the food was cooked over the camp fire or we never would have had enough fuel. If the rack was steel instead of aluminum and the fuel adjustment was a little more controllable I would have kept it but had no choice but to return it.
customer_reviews.author: FloriDuh

customer_reviews.title: save your money and buy a better one!
customer_reviews.text: this grille was a big pain camping this weekend. for starters this one does not have the electric start and I personally would spend the extra money to get that one because every time you turn the burner down low the flame would go out. the grille portion would get way to hot even when you could FINALLLY get it to stay low. also it was very uneven cooking. save your money and buy a better one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The grill’s a disaster.
customer_reviews.text: Oh dear, what a load of rubbish. Gas control is non- existent (either on or off). Worst thing is the grill, which melted when we cooked steaks on it on day 2. Come on Coleman, surely you know a grill needs to take heat! No wonder they say don’t put a pan on the grill ( and we didn’t) - they know the material is sub standard. It’s going back.
customer_reviews.author: tyke999

customer_reviews.title: Works great, cooks evenly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grill! I am so glad I didn't listen to the bad reviews. This camp stove is perfect. I used it during my week vacation to Yellowstone and it worked great. I made coffee every morning and afternoon, grilled sausage, burgers and buns with no problem. It's light The wind guards are perfect Easy to assemble for cooking Easily stored away. Easy to clean Great price Has built it handle Cooks evenly And was inexpensive I am undecided on the feet sticking up a little, which doesn't allow it to be perfectly flat, but I had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Lmeast Slacka

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would not purchase this product at all. First time using it and the griddle melted. Very upsetting. We ordered this product in May in anticipation of our July trip so unfortunately can not return to amazon. Will be returning to Coleman. I have always bought Coleman products and never seen something so cheaply made from Coleman. One of our past stoves lasted 11 years not 1 day. Makes me think twice about buying coleman at all any more. Very sad.
customer_reviews.author: Damn Computer Repair

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Stove.
customer_reviews.text: All the people who gave this stove a poor review i can only assume either have no experience with propane stoves or used the stove improperly. I have used this stove now on several camping trips without a single issue. Grill cooks up steaks and burgers perfectly and with even heat, and the stove does exactly as its supposed to. Fairly lightweight for what it is and the wind guards work very well. Overall, great quality piece of camping gear that I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota C.

customer_reviews.title: Fire Hazard - Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: We just bought this from Amazon last month. On the inaugural use the grease trap caught on fire, melted apart and fell from the grill while burning. The trap is made of plastic. Ten more seconds without extinguishing the fire and it's likely our deck would have gone up in flames.
customer_reviews.author: Ryanlga

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the dents?
customer_reviews.text: I sent back one of these because of the sharp-edged dents in the metal under the grill. The replacement stove had bigger dents and scratches in the same area. It looked like someone hammered a phillips head screwdriver into it, the second looked like a slot driver was used in a slightly different area, but both sides of the pipe as in the one shown. Really odd! I have liked Coleman a lot through the years, so I will use this, but they really need to find out what's happening in their Chinese factory. No quality control or workers are expressing anger? Very strange.
customer_reviews.author: Tartan

customer_reviews.title: photos are misleading about the griddle
customer_reviews.text: The grill itself is fine, but the photos are misleading about a griddle being included. Plus you can't purchase the one it has in the photos either. So if you are getting this because of the griddle accessory, you should get a different grill and read carefully to see if its included or not.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Andrew Wandless

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the concept of this dual-purpose camp stove but had to send it back. The manufacturer instructions said not to use any griddle with it besides the one specifically made for it. However, that griddle, sold separately, was unavailable, even from Coleman’s own website. Amazon didn’t carry it, and I couldn’t Find one in the different sporting goods stores I checked. Even tried EBay. So disappointing! I ended up buying Coleman’s three-burner campstove, which I like very much.
customer_reviews.author: SNS

customer_reviews.title: Quality fit and finish are excellant
customer_reviews.text: A perfect grill stove combo. The grill is not cast iron. So as long as you use it for its intended use of grilling meat. Then you won't destroy the grill. Nothing on it but meat. No foil, no pans, no skillets JUST MEAT. Stove side burner is small, a 6 inch skillet works fine. Hi out put on both burners. Never went above a 1/4 turn on the knob. To much heat. Very pleased with my grill stove combo.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great stove but arrived scratched.
customer_reviews.text: This stove does all that it promises - it worked perfectly right out of the box (after a small assembly). I also bought the carrying case and was happy to have that convenience (sold separately). I used the stove right away on a camping trip and both sections worked well and I was happy with the consistency of cooking. I sautéed vegetables on one side and grilled sausages and heated beans on the other. When I got home I cleaned it with no trouble. It does really go through fuel, though. I took off a star because it arrived with scratches and the side shields are weak and ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Plastic grease trap
customer_reviews.text: We had a grease fire that would not normally be a problem. But, it melted the plastic grease trap and burned through the tray caught pick nick table on fire and started the plastic legs to burn. A metal grease trap would have prevented this.
customer_reviews.author: Barry A. Odgers

customer_reviews.title: T-Bones and brats at the camp site with this grill!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I've used it a few times since getting it and the convenience of being able to throw a steak on and easily cook it, while boiling a pot of brats is so nice when camping. I'm a fan. I compared it to a 20 year old version and the knobs are bigger and stick out more, so I'm a little concerned they are the weak point. Time will tell. A case would be a smart investment.. I also got the Char Broil 4-foot hose adapter so i can run it off a big propane bottle, not just the small green ones.
customer_reviews.author: BooYaa

customer_reviews.title: Only seems to have two settings - on and off
customer_reviews.text: I just got home from a three day camping trip, using this stove for three meals each day. It worked OK, but the main burner (the right one) seems to have only a single setting (on/off) so adjusting the heat was not possible. The left burner has a similar problem, but not as bad. I had difficulty turning the heat down to a low setting. It wanted to crank the heat up but it didn't want to mellow out.
customer_reviews.author: rhj4

customer_reviews.title: Best way to enjoy a hot meal with friends!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, easy to transport, light weight. Fuel easy to get - and super cheap at Walmart vs online. Space for 6 burgers at once on the grill leaving the center "griddle" surface clear. Grill with non-stick surface. Fits in my kayak, car for car camping. Everyone who see's it, loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A

customer_reviews.title: Truly portable efficient stove
customer_reviews.text: good heat distribution on main grill and separate side burner was very handy (used for coffee percolator and small pot). Able to put large griddle across main grill and side burner effectively as well. Only drawback to this model is that it does not have an automatic lighter, you will need to light with match so bring long stemmed matches.
customer_reviews.author: robert gardner

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice camp stove but is heavy and durable. The price is right and is nice for camping. I purchased the Coleman carry case (ASIN: B00ISKDOEI) and it fits perfectly along with 2 propane bottles. If you are looking for something more portable and lightweight...checkout Jetboil systems but they are a lot more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Sigler

customer_reviews.title: Nearly useless, might work for hot dogs.
customer_reviews.text: So deceiving, this is not a functional grill. Any food that makes/drips grease causes terrible flare ups. The drip pan steers all grease right into the heat source. Tried brats and burgers on a camping trip, total failure. Darn near caused a fire. I found this “grill” in my garage today. I had forgotten about it, now it’s in the dumpster after one use.
customer_reviews.author: Brett N

customer_reviews.title: Didn't bring the Grill Flat Plate.
customer_reviews.text: The product looks nice and is easy to use but in all the pictures it shoes the grill flat plate, it didn't bring it and in the box says it sold separately (but it doesn't say anything regarding this on the Amazon post). I would've like to know beforehand because I bought it because a thought it had the 2 types of grills. I'm disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Tata186

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this because I liked my older model that needed replacement
customer_reviews.text: The grill burner tray arrived with ding marks as seen in photos. I ordered this because I liked my older model that needed replacement. I am not returning because I am leaving for vacation and have no time. Like the grill don't like the condition my new grill came in.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Miller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for chili dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this grill to take sledding. My intention was to do chili and hot dogs on the hill, as well as heat water for hot chocolate. It was PERFECT. Absolutely everything we needed for being out in the cold. We set the grill up in the back of the SUV and had lunch for 13 people done in no time flat. It is small enough to take anywhere and the perfect set up for doing more than one thing at a time. I would highly recommend this grill to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: grendel

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Well done. You can always rely on Coleman for camping accessories. I first went cheap and bought the Wal-Mart brand.. Didn't work out of the box. Ordered this thing and its the AK47 of camp grills.. Drop it, get it wet, covered in dirt and sand and shell fire right up. Happy with my purchase. Personally I've had it sitting in a salt air environment on the back of my boat. For months its given no issues or shown signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Grill
customer_reviews.text: It said don't put pots on grill and I didn't. It said nothing about putting a small piece of foil on the grill. I put a small piece of meat wrapped in foil and it destroyed the grill within seconds. The grill looks like it made of aluminum or some kind of soft metal. I am very dissatisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great acquisition!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice finished and super useful! 2 things that could be better: 1. They could have add fire starter. You will need matches 2. I don’t understand why the tube to gas tank gas to be rigid. That limits the your mobility
customer_reviews.author: Ed Besseler

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this camping stove! Took it camping for a week in a cabin with no electricity. It worked phenomenally and have used it a few times since. The only down side is there really is no medium heat on the grill side. With the slightest turn, the flame level goes from low to incinerate. Still wouldn't get rid of it. I love it. The sides pop up to hold the top up AND block the wind. The drip tray could be a little deeper but overall it's a great option for a very small price!
customer_reviews.author: Angel J.

customer_reviews.title: It was very handy and useful. Love the convenient size and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I used this grill/stove last summer camping. It was very handy and useful. Love the convenient size and ease of use. One can cook four hamburgers at a time, two steaks - for two people there is plenty of grill space. The stove burner is useful too. My only comment about that is a big fry pan does not fit unless you put the side down. The only reason I'm not giving this a five star rating is you can't turn the fire down real low. When you do it pops back up to a higher flame. I wish it came with a carrying bag and not charge so much for one separately. I would definitely buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: The grate melted!
customer_reviews.text: The second time I used it we baked potatoes. I've always wrapped my potatoes in aluminum foil and put them on the grill. Well .... the grate actual melted. The chicken burned because you can't regulate the flame very good. About all it's good for is burgers and the burner to heat water. Defenetly would not buy again. Worst part I can't return it because the return time ran out due to purchasing it prior to camping season!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Things to consider before you buy!
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this is great but it needs a few little tweaks. First off; The gas line on the inside of the grill isn’t very secure. It was fine for the first month but now it sounds like it has a gas leak when it’s on. Second is, they need to make a cover for the grill side. If you try to cook anything but thin sliced food your gonna over the outside and the inside is still gonna be raw because your not able to trap heat in like a real grill. The amount of heat it puts off is very nice and it boils water quickly.
customer_reviews.author: benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Great little stove for car camping
customer_reviews.text: Great little stove for car camping, or any time of little grilling job. The side burner is a big plus. 2 things I have noticed wit this grill is you cannot use a stiff grill brush with it, it seemed to take off the finish of the grill grates. Another thing that I have discovered is you can not cook with the lid down to get any type of internal heat, which isn't what is is made for, but of course i had to test it. overall a great little stove that i keep in my car just incase i decide I want to grill out somewhere
customer_reviews.author: Adam Yascavage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love the cook grill... So nice to have a burner and a grill and wine. We had no issues with warping Of the grill because we use it just for grilling. It is not meant for pots and pans and that’s the possibility of the grill melting.. On the left side there is a burner which is for pots and pans or coffee pots. So go for it ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Vacc

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Family of Four
customer_reviews.text: A great stove for a family of four. I can cook enough hot dogs or kebabs on the grill portion for all four of us. The burner allows a small to medium sized pot. It cleans up fairly easy as well. My only complaint is that it doesn't have a self-starter. You have to lift up the BBQ grill in order to get a lighter to it, which can be a pain when the grill is still hot. I found out later that Coleman does have the same model with a ignition system, but honestly, should that be a separate item these days?
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for your Money
customer_reviews.text: This Grill/Stove is great for feeding 2 - 4 people. We took ours camping last weekend. Used it for breakfast, lunch, & dinners. Used less than 1 can of Coleman fuel for a 3 day trip. Cooks fast, Almost too fast...Any good cook will figure out how to keep it from burning food, Boils water very fast!!! I bought the 2 pak non stick grill pads ( AS seen on TV) Cut them to fit this grill....Made clean up a breeze, Great for hash browns & Bacon. Lower the left wind protector to fit a good sized frying pan on the burner side.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great camping stove/grill
customer_reviews.text: Great camping stove/grill. Very basic you need matches or a long lighter to light. Used the basic green propane bottles. Cooking three times a day for two days used one bottle of propane so bring extras. Cleans up nice and we got a flat cast iron griddle top (from amazon) to use on the grill side for pancakes. Overall great camping stove.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: 1st use ever today an it melted waste of money do not buy this item it will just melt cant even cook 3 cheese burgers
customer_reviews.author: DQTEE

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good stove.
customer_reviews.text: Stove works good, I like the grill and I bought the optional griddle so I could do pancakes and bacon- must get the griddle! The 2 things I don't like is that it's hard to get a low flame for simmering and the wind guards keep slipping loose and flapping around. Coleman could have put a little more into this unit and it would have been excellent.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Best camping stove
customer_reviews.text: I have had other camping stoves, but this one is the best. I saw many other people use this one before buying it. The grill feature is great because you can cook directly on it, or use pots and pans. So versatile and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: David Mayberg

customer_reviews.title: MELTED GRATE! Do not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: CHEAP do not buy grill melted on second use. Unreal.. how does l metal melt like that making biscuits. Amazon replaced the item even after return window closed..
customer_reviews.author: nully6n

customer_reviews.title: I melted the grill when I tried to use a griddle on top of it.
customer_reviews.text: This stove works okay for its intended purposes, but please note that using the grill burner with a pot or pan can cause the grill top to over heat and melt! I probably should’ve read the instructions. Works well for the price, I wound up spending a little more and got a three burner Coleman which is better for cooking pancakes, eggs, bacon etc.
customer_reviews.author: Reese Farrow

customer_reviews.title: Glad to have it and it's a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: Coleman Perfect Flow Grill Stove: Nice little camp stove. Quality is reasonable and commensurate to its price. The few times that I have used it, were all favorable experiences. IF you are looking at stoves like this, this one is certainly worth a close look.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: My package came pretty beat up. The box was a tad bit beat up. Upon opening the box I found the grill will small dings here and there. As well ask the paint bubbled like it was ready to chip off. Not only that the stove feels a bit cheap for $74
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Wong

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stove but note this is NOT the self lighting model - the picture is wrong
customer_reviews.text: Nice stove, works just like it says. But, as often is the case with Amazon, what you see is NOT what you get... Note that the picture is the self-lighting model, but the stove that showed up was NOT self lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Very portable and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I just doing a review base on one I had from Coleman, they very durable and does the work that is intended, very portable, small and lightweight, excelente for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: Cooks fast
customer_reviews.text: Cooked burgers and hot dogs and steaks in no time. The pot burner heats up food or water in no time as well. I got this model without the ignition switch cause I don’t really care for it. I like to use a long lighter instead.
customer_reviews.author: Boone

customer_reviews.title: Not worth.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of grill burner is not good. It seems like if you keep using for little long it will break. I am not comformatable using it. I was expecting better quality. The cover is also little stiff to put the locks in it.
customer_reviews.author: Pranav Mahajan

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: Great stove. Recently used on a road trip. Light and portable. Only thing that needs improving is the flame control. The knobs are a bit tight and very touchy. It would be nice if the tube that the regulator is on was flexible. Other than that, it was flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Lookin Up

customer_reviews.title: Good stove/grill bit wind guard sucks
customer_reviews.text: Grill gets pretty hot quick. Cooks my burgers nice and fast. The material seems not as high quality as say camp chef. Or what i remember from older colemans The wind guard flaps locking holes SUCKS you tap it or the wind blow it and it falls back out. It still does the job but wind guard flap is annoying. Trying to find a way to secure it
customer_reviews.author: Geniv

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a camping trip
customer_reviews.text: Since we already have a regular coleman 2 burner I wasn't sure if the grill side was really such an advantage but I'm really glad to have gotten this. Not only does the grill do a great job, it's easy to clean, and we also noticed it heats up faster using less fuel than the trusty old two-burner by comparison. My one gripe is that right after I bought it Amazon's price dropped twenty bucks!
customer_reviews.author: cgreen37

customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace bulky barbecue on a boat. Much more portable, more easily stored. Instant intense heat. grill adequate size, does a good job with steaks, fish. One minor complaint: The metal pipe which brings propane from the 1 lb. coleman containers is awkward. Would prefer a flexible coupling. There may be such, but I haven"t found it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Butler

customer_reviews.title: Coleman grill stove
customer_reviews.text: The burner works great, but the grill part burns most foods unless you put a griddle over the top
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline B.

customer_reviews.title: high quality
customer_reviews.text: like this grill very much, just wish i had paid attention to the fine print...."NO ELECTRONIC IGNITER!" Other than that,...Love this grill! Have already made 30 to 40 meals on it and it's still like brand new. Coleman,...You just can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Great grill, reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: More control over temperature than most other portable grills. The design allows for even heat dispersion The stove feature is convenient, and works perfectly. No complaints. The reason I am rating it 4 stars instead of 5: You have to buy the griddle separately, which costs $30. Make sure you buy the correct griddle, as Coleman makes a variety of sizes. Overall, I am happy with my purchase and would recommend this grill to others.
customer_reviews.author: PamA

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this grill and it was missing the pieces to attach the legs. There is no parts chart to provide the size and i evidently am not smart enough to work through the maze of coleman.com to get help. Very frustrating. Everything is good until it isn't and then it is impossible to get resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great camping staple!
customer_reviews.text: I love Coleman and this grill is another great product of theirs. It’s sturdy and easy to take apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: It’s a beautiful grill tho
customer_reviews.text: There’s a manufacturing defect that leaves little dents in the inside. It looks scratched almost. Returned it and had a new one sent. And the divits were in the exact same spot. It’s a beautiful grill tho. The dents are inside on the bottom. Can’t see them when it’s put together.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Davis

customer_reviews.title: Wind free side burner
customer_reviews.text: Like the burner, blew as hard as I could and it will not blow out. Sharp parts ,no igniter or carry handle. Will have to buy a bag sold separately to carry and store.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P

customer_reviews.title: Small, convenient package for camping and picnics - grill and stove all-in-one = Incredibly Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredibly convenient concept and saves a ton of space. A high performance burner, and a great grill too. It's not the amazing grill at your house, but does such a convenient job camping or on the go. The one minus is that I had trouble / was not able to set very low settings for both the stove or grill. Both run relatively hot and cooking has to be watched carefully. This could go from 4* to 5* if the gas flow could be turned to lower levels. This saves the space of an inconvenient grill (like a BabyQ) + a stove and/or charcoal to a campground, just such a convenient all-in-one option!
customer_reviews.author: SFtodo-Dot-Com

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: After our first use the grill collapsed. It was only delivered with 3 out of 4 of the feet needed to keep it off of the the table and the knobs didn’t not reduce the heat as expected. If I could I’d give 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Great little travel grill. Lots of use & uses.
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill! We could Ike’s a giant soup, lots of burgers, dogs, sausages, chicken, coffee, eggs, etc. This saved me during the hurricane last year, & the tanks are cheap & easy enough to replace
customer_reviews.author: Rae B

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad grill at all.. I love the stove top grill combo. Came in handy for my camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: William Robinson

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the purchase of Grill / stove
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the purchase of Grill / stove, very good quality, the flame is powerful for size and kitchens very fast. I did camping for 2 days, burgers, water for coffee, bacon, eggs, rice. Use 3/4 of a cylinder of 6oz gas gave me good performance ... WHAT I DO NOT LIKE the flame makes a lot of noise and it seems that the gas is escaping and the knobs do not have high and low marker. Even so I am very satisfied with the purchase. Totally recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Yuly L.

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill!
customer_reviews.text: Best grill ever. We ( family of 4) use it at home as well as on camping trips. A little different not being able to close the lid while grilling, but so far everything we cook on this grill is amazing. Stove boils water quicker than our gas range. Bought the griddle for breakfast and the 20lb tank adaptor, both are fantastic accessories. This grill is very easy to clean, which was a big factor for me as I didn't want to spend much time cleaning it while camping. Perfect buy, perfect price. Well done Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: aime

customer_reviews.title: A Great Perchase
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! A must have when camping in Arizona during fire restrictions. The grill was perfect for grilling our steaks the first night, hamburgers the second and hot dogs for lunch and snacking both days. And, before I forget, breakfast for three days.The griddle attachment is a must and the side burner works just as well. The grill and griddle clean up really easy. Also, the overall construction quality is excellent. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: Temperature knob is tricky but great little grill
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this during the summer but barely used it a month ago when we ran out of propane. I agree with most reviewers that the temperature is hard to gauge using this grill. Make sure you watch chicken for example. Mine overlooked when I used the same cooking time as my large grill. The temperature knob is tricky to adjust to the right flame level. But still it's a great little grill, it's easy to clean too!
customer_reviews.author: SillyGurl

customer_reviews.title: Great Camping Stove!
customer_reviews.text: This grill was great for our camping trip. We were able to use a small pot on one side and frying pan on the other. It was easy to light and to control heat. Our cast iron pan worked the best. I recommend that you clean it right after you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: Grill and burner in one.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what "thickness" is about. The stove is like the regular one, but has a very handy and functional grill.
customer_reviews.author: John Q Publique

customer_reviews.title: Great stove, works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Great stove, works perfectly, wife used it on a month long adventure with our three kids and it was great. Perfect size as well, does not take up a lot of room when packing back of truck. Highly suggest this product and perfect for anyone who camps often. Propane last pretty long as well.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Skillet not included
customer_reviews.text: I would not have purchased this if I had known that the skillet was not included. Very disappointed. There were other comparable brands.
customer_reviews.author: this guy

customer_reviews.title: Nice combo stove
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little combo stove for camping, light weight, nice to have both a burner for coffee or pot & grate for grilling.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi H

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Hotter then the last grill, works great. I dinged it one star because attaching the regulator to the grill is not so easy. Seemed like it was in all the way but it was not. If the threaded brass fitting was longer it would be much easier to attach.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Great little combo, one complaint
customer_reviews.text: Great little combo. This replaced our grill and stove and takes up about half of the space. The description says Blue but other reviewers stated they received Black. We received a Black stove/grill, which was a good thing. My only complaint is that if you accidentally bump the wind protectors inward, the whole lid collapses and falls back. I'm sure we can jimmy something, but I wish the set up weren't as sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: A garbage product
customer_reviews.text: This Coleman grill/stove is garbage! The material is cheap, if you get grease stains on it good luck removing it off. The surface is not easy to wipe off, any food stain will stay put on the material. Waste of money, very disappointed in Coleman products.
customer_reviews.author: Sothea Chheng

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one of these
customer_reviews.text: First one lasted many years. With the proper care these can last many, many yerars
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Reese

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Use it for camping and this thing is awesome!! Love that we can grill stuff too!! Easy to clean and store! Coleman makes a good product. Good price too for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: AliciaC

customer_reviews.title: stupid
customer_reviews.text: What is the point of having a grill you can take off and replace with a griddle when you no longer make the griddle? That's right. Just try finding that griddle.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Burns much cleaner
customer_reviews.text: When I first lit this it seemed like it didn't work. But it burns so much cleaner it is hard to see the flame in daylight. No more black bottoms of pots and pans. The left side burner is like cooking with a blow torch! It heats up water very quickly. Much more intense flame than on my old unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Great.. but.....
customer_reviews.text: HOWEVER!! Mine came damaged.. I was afraid to use it, but had to buy and use last minute due to fire ban. Idk how long it will last with the holes at the bottom and dents..
customer_reviews.author: Kylie the camper

customer_reviews.title: Expected better from Coleman
customer_reviews.text: This fairly costly grille doesn't have a built in igniter, or a carry handle. My old cheapy grill had a built in igniter and the whole grill was $19.99 Disappointed in Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Arrivent with dents on the inside (which makes it harder to clean) and its not just me that received the item like this take a look at other reviews.I asked for a replacement but it came with worse indentations on the inside than the first one. The gas setting is very lose. Either full blast gas or nothing at all. Overall Is a poor quality item and I wouldn't recommend. Sad to see Colemans quality of products go.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha K.

customer_reviews.title: get cookin
customer_reviews.text: not used yet but will help for food prep while camping
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for the outdoors boyfriend
customer_reviews.text: This was a bday gift to the boyfriend. Easy to set up, very clear instructions (which he read). He was extremely happy. Got major girlfriend points on this lol
customer_reviews.author: Christina North

customer_reviews.title: but like other reviewers the grill side was more difficult to ...
customer_reviews.text: we took this camping last week. My first time going as the cook. Got the job done. I was able to control the temp on the burner side no problem, but like other reviewers the grill side was more difficult to tame the flame. I cooked very simple.. did a great job on the burgers and hot dogs. No major complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It does go from 0%-110% with a slight turn of the knob, but it is possible to eventually get it to the right amount heat. It can get very hot. I would put aluminum foil in the bottom of the burner (with a hole poked out for the drain) for easy cleanup. It does make it difficult to use a griddle because of uneven surfaces, but it is possible (just be careful). The left burner will fit small pots well, but nothing much bigger than a small-medium pot. A little bit of ingenuity goes a long way with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Hazard

customer_reviews.title: Really like this unit
customer_reviews.text: Really like this unit. We bought this because we don't like cooking inside the travel trailer. We also bought the griddle for it. When we bought it ours did not have the auto start on it, as that option / model difference was not clear on Amazon. However, I'm don't really care about that option anyway. Due to the size of the burner you may not be able to use very large pans, but if you drop the shields and back down it will work okay.
customer_reviews.author: NCW06

customer_reviews.title: Son Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this little stove, he couldn't be happier with the product and ease of use. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: You can NOT get the griddle anywhere..
customer_reviews.text: Just received Have not used it yet but very disappointed that it does not come with the griddle that is in the picture and u can not buy it as a separate piece anywhere. The hole reson I got this grill was because of the 3 different ways u could cook on it Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough if you can live with its weaknesses
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed with this is that the controls are super-sensitive. They're marked for ~120° zero-to-full but in fact are more like 5°. Ignore the markings and eyeball the flame when making any adjustments. That said, it's great for boiling water or grilling fast-cook foods but you'll find it a challenge to cook anything slowly. I haven't tried it yet, but I expect the griddle accessory will be difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Ok little stove. Burners need to have better adjustment knobs. It’s either high or higher. That’s my only complaint
customer_reviews.author: elsa caro

customer_reviews.title: This thing is fantastic, easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic, easy assembly, easier cleanup, grilled 2 16oz t-bones to perfection on the grill Only complaint is the sensitivity of the adjustments which others have mentioned but it's not too difficult to compensate for.
customer_reviews.author: Ocean Airbrush

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little grill
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little grill. Works great for cooking the boat. Biggest Complaints -No ignitor, have to carry a lighter -Gas comes on too fast, tough to dial in a low heat
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

product_meta.title: Coleman Camp Propane Grill/Stove
product_meta.description: Sauté veggies while you're grilling up chicken, or get the soup going while you're cooking up burgers when you pack the propane-powered Coleman Camp Propane Grill/Stove+. This durable, steel-crafted outdoor appliance offers camp cooks a grill and stove at the same time. The stove surface fits a 10-in. pan, and the 130-sq.-in. grill area offers plenty of room. The stove and grill equally share 22,000 BTUs of fully-adjustable cooking power. Meanwhile, the PerfectFlow pressure control technology keeps the heat steady, even in extreme conditions. WindBlock panels help shield your flame from wind, and on calm days, they fold down for use as side tables. When the meal is over, the grates and grease management tray remove for simple and quick cleanup.
feature_bullets: 2-in-1 design so you can use the grill and stove at the same time
Fits a 10-in. pan on the stove area
2 independently adjustable burners give you precise control for 2 temperature zones
Removable grease management tray for easy cleaning with less spillage
Non-skid feet let you stir pots and pans with ease
Wind Block panels help shield burners from wind or fold down for use as side tables
PerfectFlow technology provides consistent performance, even in extreme conditions
PerfectHeat technology for more efficient cooking with less fuel

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
